metadata.Title: CVE-2013-2200 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
WordPress before 3.5.2 does not properly check the capabilities of roles, which allows remote authenticated users to bypass intended restrictions on publishing and authorship reassignment via unspecified vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2200` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 3.5.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 3.5.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfifteen - 3.5.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfourteen - 3.5.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentysixteen - 3.5.2+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.5.2+dfsg-1').
